transcript:
forehand to meet all objections be they what they might. 
"If he could attack us, he would have done so today," said he. 
"So you think he is powerless?" said Langer- on. 
"He has forty thousand men at most," re- plied Weyrother, with the smile of a doctor to whom an old wife wishes to explain the treat- ment of a case. 
"In that case he is inviting his doom by awaiting our attack," said Langeron, with a subtly ironical smile, again glancing round for support to Milorddovich who was near him.
